results.title: In the dark
results.creator_credit: David Eady, Ronald H. Riley and Ronald H Riley and Associates
results.brief_description: Shows what can be done to prevent a variety of accidents. Analyses one industrial accident and shows how easily the complacency of management, the foolishness of workers, domestic and social pressures can create danger - at work and at home - and can lead to years of heartbreak and hardship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Eady, Ronald H. Riley and Ronald H Riley and Associates

results.title: In the company of whales
results.creator_credit: Robin Brown, Channel Four Television, Discovery Networks and TVNZ
results.brief_description: Narrated by Jessica Tandy, this visually stunning documentary shows phenomenal encounters never before captured on film. Whales are enormous, powerful creatures with extraordinary grace and intelligence. They are masters of a watery realm where they have existed for more than 30 million years. Filmed in 15 locations off the coasts of five continents, this affords a comprehensive look at whales (Blue, Sperm, Right, Beluga, Bottle-nosed whale and their small relatives the dolphin) and their environment. Guided by one of the world’s leading Cetacean experts, Dr. Roger Payne, a team of underwater cameramen reveal the mysteries of whale song, their sophisticated navigation techniques, their remarkable intelligence and affectionate social behaviour emphasising that they really are the gentle giants of the deep.

results.title: In the classroom (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: James M. Smith, Davidson Films and MHC Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Specific learning disabilities”.
Defines and documents the most common types of specific learning disabilities. Presents a language learning hierarchy, illustrated by film footage, to show how and why learning disabilities impair academic development and discusses resources outside of the school which can offer evaluative and remedial help.

results.title: In the city
results.creator_credit: Nandor Jenes, Donald Batchelor and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of a young English migrant living in an inner city area of Melbourne. Shows him at school, at home, at work in his part-time job selling newspapers and at the Newsboys’ Club. Presents a glimpse of Melbourne in the mid-60’s when city people appear to be pressured by time, living on top of each other while Australia has so much wide open space to offer. In families, everyone helps, but time unfortunately waits for no-one.

results.title: In the bush [Greek Version]
results.brief_description: This film provides a view of some unique Australian birds and animals. In particular, the platypus, echidna, kangaroo and koala in natural surroundings. Commentary in Greek language only - no subtitles. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: In the beginning. Part I
results.brief_description: Sir Kenneth Clark discusses Egypt and the Nile valley. Shows him travelling there and pointing out the ways isn which Egypt flourished as an early civilisation. Presents the art and architecture of that early time. Part I of a two part series. Suitable for upper secondary level. NB: Part II (reel 2) is missing

results.title: In spite of wishing and wanting
results.creator_credit: Wim Vandekeybus, Bart Van Langendonck, Quasi Modo and Ultima Vez
results.brief_description: Ultima Vez is a dance company formed by director, choreographer, actor and photographer Wim Vandekeybus in 1985. His style is high adrenaline with genuine sense of jeopardy and he draws his dance vocabulary from everyday movement. In creating this piece, Vandekeybus worked in close collaboration with composer David Byrne and with an all-male company. Poetic and passionate, the performance is a powerful and moving mix of movement, music, symbol, words and silence that explores the different tensions, responses, emotions and energy generated by the single-sex cast. This screen adaption of ‘In Spite of Wishing and Wanting’ based on the 1999 dance performance of the same name was shot in the atmospheric surroundings of a racetrack and at the beautiful ballroom-concert hall ‘Vooruit Arts Center’ in Ghent, Belgium. For further information go to http://www.ultimavez.com/
